entry.content:
The abort controller should only be used after the `n.c.get` call. In

cases it's not (e.g. compromised renderer), we should kill the offending

renderer process instead of a CHECK that crashes the entire browser

process tree per the suggestion from the linked bug.

entry.title: Reland "Fix race condition and re-enable tests."
entry.content:
This reverts commit b61b08b7a92b78fab36894c855d7866bc45e8ba4.



Reason for revert: Work around a potential additional race condition that could leave a help bubble anchored to a view that is no longer on any widget, leading to a crash. Now, the help bubble detects when the view has been pulled and immediately closes.



This should be a significant improvement in the help bubble anchoring behavior, cutting out a number of edge cases (many of which manifest in side panel).



Original change's description:

> Revert "Fix race condition and re-enable tests."

>

> This reverts commit 9a19121ba164716769ebb468350fa57ef28b44cc.

>

> Reason for revert: Using WebContentsObserver brought back an old crash bug, which I now recall is why we were using the render widget host. This CL needs to be reverted.

>

> See the failure here:

> https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8775645265322080401/test-results?q=HelpBubbleFactoryWebUIInteractiveUiTest.FloatingHelpBubbleHiddenOnWebUiHidden&sortby=&groupby=

>

> Original change's description:

> > Fix race condition and re-enable tests.

> >

> > Failures were caused by a race condition in HelpBubbleHandler that could affect Aura platforms. This update fixes the race condition, which caused the affected tests to flake, by switching to observing WebContents visibility rather than RenderWidgetHost.

> >

> > Bug: 1462896

> > Change-Id: Id22b2b55a40286bde96e2e14dbe4fde4f10cd692

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4675972

> > Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

> > Commit-Queue: Dana Fried

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169986}

entry.title: [omnibox] Wait for webui omnibox handler to avoid races and guarding
entry.content:
This CL blocks the main thread very briefly during location bar view

initialization so that the webui omnibox can behave as if it were

loaded synchronously. Without this, defensive checking would be needed

everywhere, and there'd be no way to ensure consistent behavior since

the first calls executed may or may not succeed depending on timing.

True synchronous loading would be preferable but may require a WebView

to load an internal chrome:// URL from within the browser process.

Another option might be to implement a sequencing layer that ensures

calls execute in order after initialization, but a short wait on init

seems cleaner and makes the cost of webui initialization explicit.



Bug: 1396174

entry.content:
In these cases it is quite simple to avoid invalidating certain

pseudo-class states as well as the cached visited link cache.



In principle we could also skip some of this if the link is changed

in a way that has the same visited hash (e.g., by changing from

a relative to absolute URL with the same resolved URL), but that's

harder and unlikely to be a common case.

entry.title: [tracing] Fix out of process Background tracing histogram rules
entry.content:
- BackgroundTracingAgent uses histogram name to trigger. This doesn't

work when multiple rules are registered for the same histogram with

different value ranges. This is fixed by using rule_id to identify

rules.

- BackgroundTracingAgent sends a trigger for histogram samples that

happened before SetUMACallback(). This becomes an issue when rules trigger multiple times for the same histogram whenever they are re-enabled.

Presumably, this logic was useful for legacy REACTIVE mode to increase change of catching triggers, but this isn't used in practise. This isn't useful for PREEMPTIVE mode since the histogram trigger will be outside the trace.



Change-Id: I4fc036ff90a4d29c9f22280094dc6580469e1658

entry.title: [Extensions] Move ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter into its own files.
entry.content:
This CL splits this class into its own source file. This will make it

easier to do the refactoring work necessary to convert the singleton

event router into per-BrowserContext event routers. It also reduces

the size and complexity of web_request_api.* files.



This is mostly a move of the source code. Care was taken to ensure

the headers included in the new files are the proper set that don't

rely on transitive includes. Some care was taken to clean up the

files included in the web_request_api.* files, but there may be some

further cleanup to do.



Changes that aren't just moves:



1. Tricium warnings that suggest deleted functions be in the public

section of the class definition were addressed.

2. One "for" loop to do searching was converted to use std::find_if.

3. In order to keep some string constants properly segregated in the

new file, an accessor function was added to generate these, and that

accessor is called in the old file.

4. A TODO was added to clean up the added accessor which is used to

register EventRouter::Observer instances for the named events. All

of this should be moved into the new per-BrowserContext

WebRequestEventRouter instances.



Bug: 1433136

entry.title: RELAND: media/gpu/v4l2: wait for and produce |CAPTURE_queue_| decoded pics
entry.content:
This CL relands the one below; it was reverted after breaking

lacros-arm-archive-rel, due to an "unused" variable. The offending

code is

```

const auto res = HANDLE_EINTR(write(wake_event_.get(), &buf, sizeof(buf)));

DPLOG_IF(ERROR, res < 0) << "Error writing to |wake_event_|";

```



which I think it should be fine -- |res| is used for a DPLOG_IF().

Filed a bug for this: crbug.com/1465861. In the meantime I'll add

the bot here (or a close one) and see if I can repro the failure.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:lacros-arm-generic-rel

Bug: b:279980150, 1465861



Original CL description ------------------------------------------------



This CL implements the (blocking) waiting for decoded pictures on

|CAPTURE_queue_|, extracting those decoded pictures, producing the

associated VideoFrames and recycling them when available. It

essentially completes the decoding part, albeit there might be

circumstances where the logic stalls.



Since the wait is blocking, it happens in a SequencedTaskRunner we

get from a pool. A convenience RearmCAPTUREQueueMonitoring() method

does the hop to WaitOnceForCAPTUREQueueEvent() with a callback to

TryAndDequeueCAPTUREQueueBuffers() when the event happens. Note that

the "wait" happens only once and is re-armed from the main thread,

which simplifies lifetime reasoning.



Only weird thing really is the specific VideoFrame handling needed

for V4L2_MEMORY_MMAP CAPTURE queue (i.e. MTK8173 Hana), where

there's some manual lifetime mgmt needed :-(



A new DecodeAndOutputAllFrames test case is added for verification,

and it passes on MT8173 Hana and QC7180 trogdor. Anecdotally, while

decoding, most queues are almost empty/full (encoded chunks/decoded

frames, respectively), pointing to the current queue mgmt as more

performant than what ToT does.



Tested on hana and trogdor via:

/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests

/usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.vp8

'--vmodule=*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=4'

--gtest_filter=*.DecodeAndOutputAllFrames

--enable-features=V4L2FlatStatefulVideoDecoder



(this decodes all frames but skips the Flush at the end because the

end-of-stream logic is not implemented).



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: I177851647c29bbe9d2335fc45dc098d0d0fa3e18

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4676285

Reviewed-by: Hang Nguyen

Reviewed-by: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

entry.title: Reland "Reland "[CR2023] Fix icons in app menu.""
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 8cced2108482bfb126f33d39ce0f86ba0fe947f4



Third time is the charm...

This is the same issue again where AppMenuBrowserTestRefreshOnly pixel tests failed.



Test failures will have a link to the corresponding skia gold image.



For example

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20Tests%20x64/82819/overview



will write in the failure the following link to triage the pixel image



```

[1556:1604:0717/034502.287:WARNING:skia_gold_pixel_diff.cc(244)] For committers not using @google.com account, triage using the following link: https://chrome-public-gold.skia.org/detail?grouping=name%3DCR2023_AppMenuBrowserTestRefreshOnly_InvokeUi_main_windows%26source_type%3Dgtest-pixeltests&digest=7b9ec227dbdd5cda46e0578c88c17283

..\..\chrome\browser\ui\test\test_browser_ui.cc(170): error: Value of: VerifyUi()

Actual: false

Expected: true

```

entry.title: CR2023: Isolate cr_elements's stacking contexts
entry.content:
CR2023 required adding z-indexes to layers to make sure state layers,

content, and backgrounds were layered properly. Setting `isolation` to

`isolate` should ensure each component has its own stacking contexts

and that the layers do not interfere with other elements or each other.



Some of these may not be necessary because the stacking context is

created in other ways, but adding them to all of them just in case.



Fixed: 1465538

entry.title: QuickStart: Base64 encode certificate before sending to Gaia
entry.content:
Gaia expects the device attestation certificates in a `bytes` proto

field. SecondDeviceAuthBroker sends a JSON request - and hence needs to

Base64 encode the certificate chain so that Gaia can decode it into a

`bytes` proto.



Additionally, add a strong type alias for the certificate chain -

`PEMCertChain` - instead of `std::string` so that the underlying

encoding is clear from the data type.



Bug: b/259021973

Change-Id: I69d14ea56598b5f3e4d75087a1af90520d0ba6c5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687270

Reviewed-by: Joe Antonetti

Reviewed-by: Renato Silva

Commit-Queue: Kush Sinha

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171773}

entry.title: Remove incognito mode PersonalDataManager.
entry.content:
The PersonalDataManager (PDM) is a KeyedService. Currently, a separate

instance exists in and outside of incognito mode. This has been the

source of a lot of confusion and bugs in the past, e.g.

crbug.com/1352063.



As it turns out, the incognito mode version is (almost) unused. It was

thus decided to remove it entirely. See doc linked in this CL's bug for

details why this is safe.

This is done by changing the PersonalDataManagerFactory's

ProfileSelection configuration and redirecting usages to the original

profile's PDM. All uses of PersonalDataManagerFactory::GetForProfile()

that "manually" redirect to the original profile are changed.



This makes it possible to remove any is_off_the_record checks in the

PDM's implementation.



This CL furthermore adds some documentation to some of the key lines

that make Autofill work in incognito mode. Namely,

- AutofillClient::GetPersonalDataManager(): Makes filling possible by

providing the non-incognito PDM. Now just "the only" PDM.

- AutofillManager::OnFormSubmitted(): Prevents imports in incognito

mode.



Lastly, this CL fixes a crash in the CreditCardAccessManager, where in

incognito mode, the strike database is not available. This was through

to be fixed with crbug.com/1409122 - but since the "fix" used the PDM's

IsOffTheRecord(), the check is actually always false. This is fixed by

using the client's state instead.



This CL affects many files, since the `is_off_the_record` parameter

from the PDM's Init() function is removed. In most cases, this is a

no-op, since it was false anyways. The few tests that test the off the

record behavior are removed.



Bug: 1007974

Fixed: 1322688

entry.title: Speculative fix for perf regression from declarative DOM Parts
entry.content:
The only real change made in [1] is the set of feature flag

checks in HTMLConstructionSite::InsertComment() and

HTMLConstructionSite::ExecuteTask(). This CL moves that feature

flag check up to the constructor, and uses the presence of

pending_dom_parts_ as the feature check, which should hopefully

be faster than RuntimeEnabledFeatures.



In the process, I also removed InitFragmentParsing() and combined

it with the constructor call for HTMLConstructionSite. I'm hoping

that doesn't have any negative perf impact, and might even result

in a progression for fragment parsing?



Bug: 1453291

entry.title: [lacros] Operate over float in set_rounded_clip_bounds
entry.content:
This CL is a follow up of https://crrev.com/c/4651456, where

the rounded corners clipping rect was introduced.

Problem is that it introduced a set of integers parameters

(x,y wXh) for the clipping rect, however:



1/ in the client side it is represented by gfx::RectF;

2/ in the client side the rect float values were being rounded

down, when being implicitly converted from float to int.

3/ in the server side it builds up a gfx::RectF instance.



For compatibility reasons, this CL deprecates the previous

incarnation of this API, and introduces a new one.

A clean up pass of this protocol is suggested for when

it stabilizes.



BUG=1443413

R=fangzhoug@igalia.com

the same size. This is guaranteed in BAM::FillOrPreviewDataModelForm but

the old behavior that marks all fields as relevant or suggestion if the

real statuses cannot be computed.

entry.title: Synthetic gestures only dispatch to visible widget
entry.content:
This UAF is caused by a synthetic pointer being routed to browser UI. In

this case, it starts dragging a tab which starts a nested message loop

Further events and gestures are processed in this nested loop and

cleaned up. When the message loop returns the stack contains the cleaned

up pointers.



Synthetic gestures shouldn't be able to target UI outside the web

contents area. The event location is intersected with the web contents'

RenderWidget's view bounds to prevent this [1]. However, the bounds will

be inaccurate if the widget is in a background tab; it won't receive

resizes until it's foregrounded (it's also bad that we can dispatch

events to a different tab).



This CL fixes the issue by ensuring events are dispatched only to a

foregrounded widget. If a synthetic gesture is started while the widget

is in a background tab, its start is deferred until it comes into the

foreground. If the widget is backgrounded while a gestuere is in

progress, the gesture is aborted.



Note: we don't do this for DevTools injected events as those skip event

routing and go straight to the injecting renderer. The comment in [2]

makes me think this is a common use case.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:content/browser/renderer_host/input/synthetic_gesture_target_base.cc;l=155;drc=ac872e771ce001fef191848bab4167d60dfda403

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:content/browser/renderer_host/input/synthetic_gesture_target_aura.cc;l=140;drc=ac872e771ce001fef191848bab4167d60dfda403



Bug: 1444597

Change-Id: I2955ce60357f7f03e62f44fd1497bd4ea598f660

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4666793

entry.title: Revert "[Office upload] Always use a Copy IO Task when uploading to Drive"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6129485af6c8259267e7b0e588e1e684b7e02a42.



Reason for revert: Suspected of causing failures on MSAN builders, e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37216



Original change's description:

> [Office upload] Always use a Copy IO Task when uploading to Drive

>

> Previous Upload to Drive flow:

> - Copy/Move IO task.

> - Sync to Drive.

> - Call upload callback.

>

> New Upload to Drive flow:

> - Copy:

> - Copy IO task.

> - Sync to Drive.

> - OnEndCopy:

> - If the upload was successful and was supposed to be a Move:

> - Delete the source file.

> - If the upload was unsuccessful:

> - Delete the destination file.

> - Call upload callback.

>

> Subscribe to Delete IO task updates to ensure the upload doesn't

> complete until the delete has completed.

>

> This change was introduced so a Cancel button can be added to the

> progress notification for a Move to Drive upload. The source file is

> deleted after the Move IO task completes. So now if the user clicks the

> Cancel button during the sync phase, there is no need to awkwardly

> restore back the source file.

>

> Bug: b/244396230

> Change-Id: Ia6f4263e9cd826a3f7ab4a1c694f9d65621e687a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680762

> Reviewed-by: Peter Marshall

> Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171602}



Bug: b/244396230

Change-Id: I35b68047eff5b59c80d096ce078b2827ece55b76

entry.title: [exo] Operate over float in set_rounded_clip_bounds
entry.content:
This CL is a follow up of https://crrev.com/c/4651456, where

the rounded corners clipping rect was introduced.

Problem is that it introduced a set of integers parameters

(x,y wXh) for the clipping rect, however:



1/ in the client side it is represented by gfx::RectF;

2/ in the client side the rect float values were being rounded

down, when being implicitly converted from float to int.

3/ in the server side it builds up a gfx::RectF instance.



For compatibility reasons, this CL deprecates the previous

incarnation of this API, and introduces a new one.

A clean up pass of this protocol is suggested for when

it stabilizes.



BUG=1443413



Change-Id: I360e94ce6e4172b6edc11a1caf5539deee49af52

entry.title: kiosk: Introduce CancellableJob
entry.content:
Details of jobs like RetryRunner currently leak to callers, who need to

know or forward declare the implementer classes.



We introduce the CancellableJob interface and make RetryRunner and

CheckCryptohome jobs implement it.



Fixed: b:291274745

Test: testing/xvfb.py tools/autotest.py -C out/Release --run_all chrome/browser/ash/app_mode/retry_runner_unittest.cc chrome/browser/ash/login/app_mode/test/web_kiosk_browsertest.cc

used to override the path to a file.

entry.title: [iOS] Implement UIShutdownNoDismiss in UserSigninCoordinator
entry.content:
This patch implement correctly the case to interrupt

UserSigninCoordinator and AuthenticationFlow for

SigninCoordinatorInterrupt::UIShutdownNoDismiss.



For UIShutdownNoDismiss case, the UI doesn't need to be dismiss, but

sign-in completion block and the interrupt completion block need to be

called in that order and synchronously before the end of

-[SigninCoordinator interruptWithAction:completion:].



Related to crrev.com/c/4665648.



Fixed: 1455216

Bug: 1464582

entry.title: [ios] Refactor settings code about UserSelectableType::kPayments
entry.content:
Starting with https://crrev.com/c/4660713, kPayments is also listed as

syncer::UserSelectableType, which unblocks simplifications in UI code.

Ideally kPayments should share most code with other user-selectable

types, modulo the special-casing required for the payments-autofill

coupling (until crbug.com/1435431 is tackled).



In this patch, as a first step, the code to construct

autocompleteWalletItem is refactored, to lean on the common

tableViewItemWithDataType() function.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix testAdvancedSettingsWithSyncPassphrase
entry.content:
testAdvancedSettingsWithSyncPassphrase flaks are in

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/first_run/first_run_egtest.mm;l=602;drc=d6f0474de0814bee9f92efb43d2a1cf936c16cdc



The issue is the tablecell that contains "Encryption" is:

"Cannot perform tap at {nan, nan} as it is outside window's bounds"



It seems that when searching for the table cell, it is found when

being outside of the window, therefore the scrollview is not used.



To solve the flake, "grey_sufficientlyVisible()" is added to the

matcher for the "Encryption" table view.



According to the 7 ios-simulator-noncq runs, it fixed the flaks for

this test.



Fixed: 1464973

entry.title: Reland "[dpwa] Replaces 2 check actions CheckAppToolbar[Not]Visible with CheckWindowControlsOverlayToggleIcon."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 7eda64a5236a2e0dad4362a33ff6d9619086c1a5

The test is flaky on ChromeOS lacros run and so the action is disabled

on ChromeOS for now.



Original change's description:

> [dpwa] Replaces 2 check actions CheckAppToolbar[Not]Visible with

> CheckWindowControlsOverlayToggleIcon.

>

> The purpose of CheckAppToolbarVisible and CheckAppToolbarNotVisible is

> to determine if the WCO toggle button exists. But the implementation

> doesn't work for all platforms because the toolbar still exists on Mac

> even if the app window in fullscreen mode.

> Combined the 2 actions into 1 action. The new action checks if the

> toolbar exists first, if it exists, we will check if the toggle icon is

> there.

>

> Bug: b/288629264

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Reset pointer flags after user move or resize operation
entry.content:
This fixes an issue where Chromium still believes that the left mouse

button is being held down after a window move operation.



This causes `CompoundEventFilter` to refuse to set the appropriate

cursors in the non-client area, leading to issues like

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1454893.



Bug: 1432559, 1454893

entry.title: QuickStart: Use Base64UrlString type for challenge data
entry.content:
Use Base64UrlString instead of std::string as the data type of challenge

data to avoid encoding issues. std::string doesn't reveal the encoding

of the underlying data. This can lead to some fields storing raw bytes

while the expected storage was base64url encoded string.



Bug: b/259021973

entry.title: dlp: Add FileBackedBlobFactory interface and browser side
entry.content:
This CL adds a new interface to register file backed blobs.

For frames, this interface is in sync with navigation and thus

can be used to retrieve the URL from which blobs are accessed.

This will be used to perform data leak prevention checks for

managed users having specific file related policies.



This CL only adds the interface and its browser-side implementation.

For the actual usage see children CLs in the relation chain.



See also comments and discussions in the original big CL https://crrev.com/c/4249117/159, from which this one was extracted.



More info:

- design doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tiK7HcFivDIK288PlEtqxPWEhMy-A5FjPf0A8Gmx4g4/edit#bookmark=id.wbsjo0yog42m)

- slightly more detailed overview (http://docs/document/d/1FrYQYg7PqGmjbfsjjQx_AVcAW--KSyoYI-rL8fx-lu0?resourcekey=0-KJCn36cd-eFdWwIDhKuKuQ)



Bug: b/289974874

Test: out/Default/content_unittests --gtest_filter=FileBackedBlobFactoryImplTest.*
